articles.title: High-level Talks for Inter-Korean Summit Held
articles.content:
High-level Talks for Inter-Korean Summit Held
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- High-level talks for the inter-Korean summit took place at the Thongil House of Panmunjom Thursday amid mounting enthusiasm for national reconciliation and unity.
					 Present there were the north side delegation headed by Chairman of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Country of the DPRK Ri Son Gwon and the south side delegation with Minister of Unification Jo Myong Gyun as the chief delegate.
					
					 At the talks both sides had an in-depth discussion on technical matters related to the north-south summit and adopted a joint press release.
					
					 The press release specified the time and place of the north-south summit. Clarified in it was the fact that an agreement was reached on holding several working-level talks for its preparations and that other issues would be discussed by way of exchanging documents.

articles.title: Session of DPRK Olympic Committee Held
articles.content:
Session of DPRK Olympic Committee Held
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The session of the Olympic Committee of the DPRK Juche 107 (2018) took place at the People's Palace of Culture here on Thursday.
					 Attending it were members of the committee and officials of the sports field.
					
					 The session reviewed the work of the committee for Juche 106 (2017) and discussed its work orientation for Juche 107 (2018).
					
					 Minister of Physical Culture and Sports Kim Il Guk, chairman of the committee, made a report at the session before speeches.
					
					 The session discussed the matters for bringing about a revolutionary turn in the national sports this year marking the 70th birthday of the DPRK.

articles.title: IOC Delegation Here
articles.content:
IOC Delegation Here
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the International Olympic Committee (IOC) led by President Thomas Bach arrived here on Thursday.

articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to Nigeria Appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Nigeria Appointed
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Jon Tong Chol was appointed as the DPRK ambassador to the Federal Republic of Nigeria, according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: Spring Tree Planting Ceremony Held
articles.content:
Spring Tree Planting Ceremony Held
Phyongwon, March 29 (KCNA) -- A spring tree planting ceremony of young Red Cross volunteers took place in Sambong-ri, Phyongwon County, South Phyongan Province on Thursday on the occasion of the spring period of the general mobilization for land administration.
					 Present there were officials of the DPRK Red Cross Society, young RC volunteers and other volunteers, officials concerned and members of the delegations of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies and the International Committee of the Red Cross active in the DPRK.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Speakers referred to the activities of the young RC volunteers for forest restoration.
					
					 Saying that planting trees is an important work for the future, they underscored the need to create many forests and take good care of them in order to improve the ecological environment and ensure the human's activities for existence.
					
					 The participants planted trees of good species including pine-nut tree.
					
					 The spring tree planting campaign of young RC volunteers will go on throughout the country till April.

articles.title: Study Tour Group Arrives at Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Study Tour Group Arrives at Mangyongdae
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- A study tour group of schoolchildren from across the country for 250-mile journey for learning to mark the lapse of 95 years since President Kim Il Sung made the 250-mile journey for learning arrived at Mangyongdae, his birthplace.
					 The group left Phophyong on March 16 to go along the course associated with the footprints of the President and which was covered by leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Its members marched more than 320 kilometers past Hwaphyong, Janggang, Kanggye, Jonchon, Hyangsan, Kujang and other areas to reach Kaechon, where they took train to get to Pyongyang on Thursday.
					
					 Amid welcome by citizens, the marchers arrived at Mangyongdae.
					
					 Vice-Chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Choe Hwi, First Secretary of the Central Committee of the youth league Pak Chol Min, Chairman of the Education Commission Kim Sung Du, officials concerned and officials of the youth league greeted the marchers and joined them in the journey.
					
					 A meeting marking the arrival of the study tour group at Mangyongdae took place at Mangyongdae Revolutionary School.
					
					 Before the meeting, the participants laid a floral basket at the statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il at the school and paid respects to them.
					
					 Pak Chol Min made a report at the meeting to be followed by speeches.

articles.title: Posters on 1st Pyongyang Int'l Vocal Competition Produced
articles.content:
Posters on 1st Pyongyang Int'l Vocal Competition Produced
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Posters on the First Pyongyang International Vocal Competition were produced.
					 Printed on them are letters "The First Pyongyang International Vocal Competition" as well as the logo, period and venue of the competition.
					
					 Korean and foreign women singers and the Moranbong Theatre, the venue of the competition, are also depicted on the posters.
					
					 The posters well show the common desire of the Korean people and the world progressives to promote friendship among countries and develop the international cultural and art exchange and cooperation.

articles.title: Modernization of Iron and Steel Production Pushed Forward
articles.content:
Modernization of Iron and Steel Production Pushed Forward
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Modernization gains momentum at the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex, one of leading ferrous metallurgical bases in the DPRK, as part of its efforts to increase the quality and productivity of iron and steel.
					 The complex, in close cooperation with sci-tech institutes, has introduced advanced technologies into upgrading oxygen heat blast furnace, while directing efforts to deciding on rational proportions of raw materials and melting regulations.
					
					 It has also ensured the normal operation of large oxygen separators which play important role in the production of Juche iron. In particular, due attention has been paid to keeping dynamic balance between air and oxygen compressors and expander and applying advanced methods like heat-preserving of equipment.
					
					 At the same time, the complex has pushed ahead with the introduction of refining, micro-alloying and other technologies to raise the quality of metallic products and produce alloyed steels, including stainless and silicon steels, with locally available raw materials.
					
					 And it is being carried out at the complex to install the electromagnetic induction agitator in continuous casting machine and build a fluidized-bed gas generator for a heating furnace.

articles.title: Functional Nano Plastic Sheet for Rice-seedling Bed to Be Used in Agricultural Sector
articles.content:
Functional Nano Plastic Sheet for Rice-seedling Bed to Be Used in Agricultural Sector
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Quality functional nano plastic sheet for rice-seedling bed is to be widely used in the agricultural sector of the DPRK this year. The sheet, developed by the Agricultural Nano Technology Institute under the Institute of Agricultural Science, was introduced into farms of Pyongyang City and some provinces, including South Hwanghae Province, enjoying popularity.
					 In this regard, Han Chol Nam, section chief of the institute, told KCNA:
					
					 The efficiency and effectiveness of the sheet have been proved in reality in recent years.
					
					 Its resistance to ultraviolet is stronger than the ordinary sheet. 
					
					 The sheet does not tear easily. And it is 1.5 times in tensile strength and 2 times in extension rate compared with the preceding one.
					
					 The sheet helps raise the temperature of rice-seedling bed one degree centigrade and hasten the date of germination of seed, while increasing the germination rate by 3-5 percent and health rate of rice seedling by 5 percent.
					
					 The sheet also makes it possible to lower the incidence of rice seedling blast due to frost damage.

articles.title: Abe Group's Confrontation Racket Will Precipitate Self-destruction: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Abe Group's Confrontation Racket Will Precipitate Self-destruction: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The Abe group of Japan recently asked the chief executive of south Korea to deal with the "matter of abducted Japanese", taking issue with the DPRK. Meanwhile, Japanese Foreign Minister Kono during his junket to the U.S. met U.S. Vice-President Pence and south Korean Foreign Minister Kang Kyong Hwa to reel off a litany of invective against the DPRK, stressing the "need to maintain sanctions and pressure" upon it.
					 Abe, at a graduation ceremony of Defense University, said that the firm stand on maximum pressure upon the DPRK would not shake until it takes "concrete steps".
					
					 These are vicious and reckless behaviors that could be done only by the Japanese reactionaries accustomed to drawing water to their own mill by harming others, Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in a commentary.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 The invective of the Abe group is a revelation of the cunning intention to get rid of the tight corner by taking issue with the DPRK.
					
					 Avarice blinds one's eyes. The Abe group rushes about to disturb reconciliation and unity between the north and south of Korea and meddle in the issue of the Korean Peninsula, behaving mischievously before the south Korean and U.S. authorities. However, it is the stupid behavior of those unaware of the trend of the times. 
					
					 The Abe group, vociferating about sanctions and pressure without understanding who created the present situation, should clearly know that its reckless confrontation will precipitate Japan's isolation and self-destruction.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' persistent anachronistic hostile policy toward the DPRK would only invite bitterer denunciation and derision at home and abroad.
					
					 Those keen on confrontation going against the trend of the times will never have a chance to visit Pyongyang.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Standing up for International Justice
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Standing up for International Justice
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Thursday stresses in an article that it is a contemporary task and common duty of each country and nation to struggle for genuine international justice.
					 The imperialists are describing their interference in other countries' internal affairs and invasion of them as "just actions" for "combating terrorists", "championing human rights" and "ensuring peace", the article says, and goes on:
					
					 "War on terrorism" touted by the imperialists as one for "ensuring world peace and stability" is nothing but a state-sponsored terrorist act against anti-U.S. independent countries, an act for new war of aggression.
					
					 The imperialists often find fault with "human rights situation" in other countries while styling themselves an "international human rights judge". This is little short of an artifice for justifying their interference in internal affairs of independent countries standing against imperialism, and pressure, invasion and moves for toppling their regimes.
					
					 Typical of such acts are the U.S. invasion of Afghanistan and Iraq perpetrated under the pretext of "anti-terrorism" and "protection of human rights".
					
					 If the imperialists and hegemonic forces are allowed to perpetrate hooliganism under the mask of "justice", the world will turn into a lawless land where injustice overwhelms justice and invasion and war are rampant.
					
					 What matters is that the United Nations, which claims standing up for international justice in name, is being abused by specified countries for attaining their unreasonable purpose.
					
					 If the UN fails to set right the present abnormal situation in which high-handed and arbitrary practices by a specified state prevail and double-standards are openly connived at and allowed, it will be reduced to a nominal body and this will hinder the establishment of a fresh and fair international order. That's why a lot of member states of the UN are struggling for its reform.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Condemns Japan's Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Condemns Japan's Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the vice-representative of the Japanese mission in Geneva submitted a draft "resolution on north Korea's human rights" to the UN Human Rights Council, asserting at its 37th Session that the DPRK is "disregarding human rights".
					 In this regard, Rodong Sinmun on Thursday says in a commentary that the Japanese reactionaries' oft-repeated "human rights" racket against the DPRK in the UN arena is a manifestation of shamelessness and craftiness peculiar to Japan.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 Though Japan blames the DPRK for groundless charges, it can never get rid of its heavy responsibility for hideous crimes against humanity.
					
					 It should have guilty conscience about the past sexual slavery. It should present a frank confession to the UN Human Rights Council.
					
					 It is the height of impudence to internationalize the DPRK's non-existent "human rights issue".
					
					 It is none other than Japan which has serious human rights issue. Japan is a scene of terrible murders.
					
					 The Abe group is keen on slandering others, shunning the social system in which abnormal way of life is rampant under the sway of misanthropy and mental degeneration and crimes are widespread. It is a foolish act.
					
					 Japan, a war criminal state, should mind its own business.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Dispel Illusion about Foreign Forces
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Dispel Illusion about Foreign Forces
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- There took place in Tokyo of late a "security policy consultative meeting" between south Korea and Japan. In the wake of the meeting, a "meeting of the south Korea-U.S. combined defense council" was held in Washington.
					 They are confrontational confabs to swim against the trend of the situation on the Korean Peninsula, says Minju Joson in a commentary Thursday.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 Such acts are greatly disappointing all the fellow countrymen who earnestly desire a lasting peace on the Korean Peninsula and its independent reunification as soon as possible through the inter-Korean cooperation.
					
					 Dependence on foreign forces is extremely dangerous poison to benumb consciousness of national independence.
					
					 It is outsiders that divided the Korean nation and have blocked Korea's reunification.
					
					 The U.S. and its vassal forces are employing all sorts of sinister and childish methods to reverse the present trend of situation on the Korean Peninsula by driving a wedge between the north and the south of Korea, being displeased with it.
					
					 It is crystal clear to all that "cooperation" with foreign aggression forces seeking to fish in troubled waters after dividing the Korean nation into two and making fellow countrymen fight with each other will lead to self-destruction.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities are really interested in settling the national issue, they should dispel an illusion about foreign forces.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Marked in Russia
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Marked in Russia
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The Regional Social Organization of Russia "Borozino" formed a preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the Day of the Sun, on March 21.
					 Chairman of "Borozino" Salinikov was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee set a celebration period from March 21 to April 16 and decided to hold colorful political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and feats of the President in the period.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Marked in Egypt
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Marked in Egypt
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- An Egyptian preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the Day of the Sun, was formed on March 20.
					 Yehia Zakaria Khairullah, vice-chairman of the Socialist Freedom Party of Egypt and chairman of the Egypt-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set a celebration period from March 20 to April 15 and decided to organize political and cultural events including seminar, film show and photo exhibition to praise the revolutionary career and exploits of the President in the period.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Russia
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The Nakhodka Format Publishing House of Russia brought out in pamphlet respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Comrade Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and Our People" on the occasion of the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The work, published on April 20, Juche 101 (2012), clarifies the revolutionary exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in their lifetime.
					
					 It also indicates the tasks for firmly preserving and glorifying their ideas and exploits.
					
					 A book-releasing ceremony took place on March 20.

articles.title: Works of Peerlessly Great Men Studied Abroad
articles.content:
Works of Peerlessly Great Men Studied Abroad
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Seminars on "With the Century", President Kim Il Sung's reminiscences, took place in Hungary and Slovenia and a seminar and a reading session on respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Comrade Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and Our People" in Austria and Mexico on the occasion of the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of the President.
					 Present at the seminars were personages of various circles and masses in those countries.
					
					 Figures of political parties and organizations including the Hungarian Workers' Party and the Hungarian preparatory committee for celebrating the Day of the Sun praised the President as the greatest man who liberated the country through the anti-Japanese armed struggle and led to the victory the Fatherland Liberation War, the post-war reconstruction and socialist construction.
					
					 The chief and members of the Youth Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism formed in Austria lauded the President as a genius of ideology and theory who founded the immortal Juche idea, peerless patriot who put an end to the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists and liberated Korea, invincible and iron-willed commander who beat back the invasion of the U.S. imperialists and defended the freedom and independence of Korea, and tender-hearted father of the Korean people and elder statesman of the world who devoted his all to the prosperity of the country, happiness of its people and national reunification and the human cause of independence in his lifetime.
					
					 The chairman of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism who is director general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea read the main contents of Kim Jong Un's work and explained Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, citing achievements gained by the Korean army and people in the revolution and construction under the wise guidance of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Tienen lugar conversaciones de alto nivel para la Cumbre Norte-Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Tienen lugar conversaciones de alto nivel para la Cumbre Norte-Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 29 de marzo (ACNC) -- Cuando se hace cada dia mas fuerte el clima de reconciliacion y unidad de la nacion coreana, tuvieron lugar el dia 29 en el Pabellon Thong-il de Phanmunjom las conversaciones de alto nivel para la Cumbre Norte-Sur. 
					Asistieron a la ocasion la delegacion de la parte Norte encabezada por el presidente del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria de la RPDC, Ri Son Gwon, y la delegacion de la parte Sur con el ministro de Unificacion Jo Myong Gyun como delegado-jefe. 
					
					En la ocasion, ambas partes debatieron con seriedad los problemas de trabajo vinculados con la cumbre intercoreana y aprobaron un comunicado conjunto. 
					
					El documento indica el periodo y la sede de la cumbre anunciando que se ha acordado abrir diferentes conversaciones de trabajo para los preparativos necesarios.
					
					Y senala que los demas problemas pendientes seran discutidos a modo de intercambio de documentos.

articles.title: Se efectua asamblea general del Comite Olimpico de la RPDC
articles.content:
Se efectua asamblea general del Comite Olimpico de la RPDC
Pyongyang, 29 de marzo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 29 en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo la asamblea general del Comite Olimpico de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea-107 (2018) de la Era Juche.
					En la ocasion tomaron parte los miembros del comite olimpico y los funcionarios de la rama deportiva.
					
					La reunion hizo balance del trabajo del Comite Olimpico en el ano pasado y debatio el rumbo de sus labores para el ano en curso.
					
					Kim Il Guk, ministro de Deportes y presidente del Comite Olimpico de la RPDC, pronuncio el informe y otros intervinieron.
					
					Se abordaron en la ocasion los problemas para registrar un viraje revolucionario en las labores deportivas del pais en este ano del septuagesimo aniversario de la fundacion de la RPDC.

articles.title: Nombrado nuevo embajador coreano en Nigeria
articles.content:
Nombrado nuevo embajador coreano en Nigeria
Pyongyang, 29 de marzo (ACNC) -- Segun el decreto correspondiente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Jon Tong Chol fue designado como nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario coreano en la Republica Federal de Nigeria.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun condena la conducta conflictiva de la banda de Abe
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun condena la conducta conflictiva de la banda de Abe
Pyongyang, 29 de marzo (ACNC) -- Acusando hace poco a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, los compinches de Abe pidieron al mandatario surcoreano que aborde el "problema de japoneses raptados".
					En el encuentro con el vicepresidente norteamericano Pence y la cancillera surcoreana Kang Kyong Hwa, sostenido durante su visita a EE.UU, el canciller japones Kono abogo por "seguir manteniendo la sancion y presion" pronunciando sin parar las ya aburridas palabras conflictivas con la RPDC.
					
					Al hacer uso de la palabra en la ceremonia de graduacion de la Academia de Defensa, Abe chismeo que no se cambiara la  "firme posicion de ejercer la maxima presion" hasta que se tomen las "medidas concretas" de alguien.
					
					En un comentario individual de hoy, el periodico Rodong Sinmun califica esos actos verbales de una locura que pueden cometer solo los reaccionarios japoneses acostumbrados a satisfacer sus intereses perjudicando a otro, y continua: 
					
					Tal conducta de los compinches de Abe deviene la expresion de su astuto intento de liberarse del aprieto al acusar a la RPDC.
					
					La codicia ciega al hombre.
					
					Abe y sus seguidores, que hablan con griteria de la sancion y presion sin distinguir quien ha preparado la corriente de la situacion actual, deben tener presente que su imprudencia conflictiva adelantara mas su aislamiento y autodestruccion.
					
					Su anacronica politica hostil anticoreana causara solamente la censura y burla dentro y fuera del pais.
					
					Los enfrascados en la confrontacion no podran visitar jamas a Pyongyang.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun condena la campana de "derechos humanos" anti-RPDC de Japon
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun condena la campana de "derechos humanos" anti-RPDC de Japon
Pyongyang, 29 de marzo (ACNC) -- En la 37a reunion del Consejo de DDHH de la ONU, el representante interino japones en Ginebra de Suiza presento el borrador del "proyecto de la resolucion de DDHH del Norte (de Corea)", chismeando que la RPDC "desprecia los derechos humanos".
					La repetida campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC de los reaccionarios japoneses revela su descaro y astucia.
					
					Asi subraya el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual divulgado el dia 29 y continua:
					
					Aunque el pais isla acusa absurdamente a otros, no podra encubrir sus inauditos crimenes antieticos.
					
					Japon debe sentirse culpable de Corea y las victimas de esclavitud sexual y presentar al Consejo de DDHH de la ONU la confesion escrita reconociendo francamente esos crimenes cometidos en el pasado.
					
					Sin embargo, intenta internacionalizar descaradamente el inexistente "problema de DDHH" de la RPDC.
					
					El que tiene el serio problema de DDHH es precisamente Japon.
					
					Hoy dia, se reportan en ese pais los terribles asesinatos.
					
					En vez de acusar a otros, la banda de Abe debe arreglar primero su regimen social corrupto, misantropico, degenerado y antipopular.
